]0;eric@sjsu:~[eric@sjsu ~]$ exit

Script done on 2022-10-10 23:56:49-04:00



A3.txt Answers

1. For this question, I used " grep 'replied_to' file | cut -f 2,6 > Q1.csv" to make a file with the replies and user getting the replies.

2. To get 3 or more replies, I used "sort Q1.csv | uniq -c | sort -rn | awk '{if ($1>=3) {print $2,$3}}' " to only take the data from 3 occurences or more in this new file.

3. Used the command line in Q2 but changed the if statement for each occurences and count the wc to plot the graph.

4. Used diff downloaded_tweets... Q1.csv | cut -f4 | sort | uniq -c | sort -rn | head -30 to look for the top 30 hashtags used in these columns only.
I found that there was quite a few differences compared to the last assignment. For example, ableg, cdnpoli, onpoli, OneOfusAllofUs, insiders
SOTU, Brexit, Kyiv,ChefsForUkraine, Mariupol, Partygate, DemVoice1, and  longcovid were all new for these inputs.
